alert.note: Alert for Edwards; Kinney; Maverick; Val Verde (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 16 at 3:08AM CDT until March 16 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 9 PM TODAY FOR PORTIONS OF THE EDWARDS PLATEAU AND RIO GRANDE PLAINS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH FROM 1 PM TO 10 PM THURSDAY FOR LOCATIONS GENERALLY WEST OF A LINE FROM LLANO TO EAGLE PASS... .Very dry air across the area will continue to remain in place today, and somewhat be reinforced by a cold front moving into the area on Thursday. Minimum afternoon relative humidity will drop below 20 percent, and in some cases fall to single digits. Meanwhile, light winds in the overnight hours and morning will quickly increase and become gusty, as daytime heating promotes mixing with stronger winds aloft. The cold front moving into the area on Thursday will not bring rain, but the dry air behind it will maintain low humidity, while gusty winds will even be stronger, and continue past sunset into Thursday evening. Fuels are still in a cured state from the end of winter, and with little precipitation in the past few months, conditions are tinder dry. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR PORTIONS OF THE EDWARDS PLATEAU AND RIO GRANDE PLAINS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR PORTIONS OF THE EDWARDS PLATEAU AND RIO GRANDE PLAINS... The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 1 PM this afternoon to 9 PM CDT this evening. A Fire Weather Watch has also been issued. This Fire Weather Watch for wind and low relative humidity is in effect from Thursday afternoon through Thursday evening. * WINDS...South 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 8 percent. * IMPACTS...Any wildfires ignited may spread rapidly and unpredictably. Prevention of fire starts by avoiding planned burning, or by limiting activities prone to produce sparks can stop the start and spread of wildfires.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
